react/button-has-type.message: <button> elements defaults to type="submit" if no type is specified, which can lead to unexpected behavior in forms. Always specify the type explicitly.

unicorn/prefer-number-properties.message: ECMAScript 2015 moved globals onto the Number constructor for consistency and to slightly improve them.

import/no-duplicates.message: Duplicate imports can lead to confusion and potential bugs. Ensure that each import is unique.

import/no-empty-named-blocks.message: Empty named imports serve no practical purpose and often result from accidental deletions or tool-generated code.

no-array-constructor.message: Using the array constructor can lead to unexpected behavior. Use `Array.from` instead.

no-else-return.message: Using `else` after a `return` statement is unnecessary and can make the code harder to read. Simply return early.

typescript/prefer-ts-expect-error.message: Use `@ts-expect-error` instead of `@ts-ignore` to ensure that you are aware of the error and it is intentional. Also once the error is resolved, the comment will be detected by TS as unnecessary.

unicorn/prefer-array-index-of.message: Using Array#findIndex is unnecessarily verbose when Array#indexOf accomplishes the same thing more concisely and clearly.

unicorn/prefer-includes.message: Prefer Array#includes over Array#indexOf for existence checks because Array#includes is clearer and less error-prone.

unicorn/prefer-node-protocol.message: Use `node:` for built-in modules to avoid ambiguity and ensure clarity in module resolution.

default-case-last.message: The `default` case should always be the last case in a switch statement to ensure clarity and maintainability.

default-param-last.message: Default parameters should be placed at the end of the parameter list to avoid confusion and ensure clarity.

func-style.message: Use function declarations instead of function expressions for consistency and clarity. Arrow functions are allowed for concise syntax.

max-params.message: Functions should have a maximum of 3 parameters to ensure readability and maintainability. The maximum is set to 3 to enable `handleRequest` in app/entry.server.tsx.

no-await-in-loop.message: Using `await` inside a loop can lead to performance issues. Consider using `Promise.all` or restructuring your code to avoid this.

no-useless-call.message: Using Function#call or Function#apply is unnecessary when you can call the function directly. This can lead to performance issues.

react/no-array-index-key.message: Using array indexes as keys can lead to performance issues and bugs in React. Use unique identifiers instead.
